application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
The tree is situated in the rear of the pub on the Newport Road side. It is a mature tree in a fair to
good condition and stands alone in its area. It can be seen by road and pavement users as well as
neighbours. For these reasons, it has a high amenity value.
Due to its high amenity value we would require evidence of formation defects and that the lean is
enough for stability issues. This has not been provided with the application to fell.
The application is refused due to a lack of evidence to fell the tree.
